definition: to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
to discuss/to comment/to criticize/to judge/to choose (by public appraisal)

sentences.english: The teacher made comments on our compositions.
sentences.chinese: 老師就我們的作文作了講評。

sentences.english: The problems were evaluated comprehensively, and measures for improvement were formulated.
sentences.chinese: 綜合講評存在問題，制定改進措施。
講評員有一個重大的責任。

sentences.english: The movie tells us a lot about life.
sentences.chinese: 這部影戲講評了很多關於生活。

sentences.english: One way we learn this is through the role of grammarian.
sentences.chinese: 我們學習的方法之一，是透過扮演語言講評人的角色。

sentences.english: The target of commentary class is to find and solve the problems in learning.
sentences.chinese: 在講評課上要發現問題，從而解決問題。

sentences.english: The commentator generalized because he knew no details.
sentences.chinese: 講評者只是泛論，因爲他不知細節。

sentences.english: This article talks about the New Curriculum observation and evaluation of teaching some of the chemical methods.
sentences.chinese: 本文主要談新課程背景下化學講評課教學的一些方法。

sentences.english: Some people fear giving an evaluation.
sentences.chinese: 有些人害怕給別人講評。

sentences.english: How to Win the Evaluation Contest?
sentences.chinese: 如何在個別講評競賽中勝出？

definition: to write on the blackboard/writing on the blackboard
to give a small demonstration of one's impressive skills (idiom)

the Book of History, one of the Five Classics of Confucianism 五經|五经[Wu3 jing1], a compendium of documents which make up the oldest extant texts of Chinese history, from legendary times down to the time of Confucius, also known as 尚書經|尚书经[Shang4 shu1 jing1], 尚書|尚书[Shang4 shu1], 書|书[Shu1]
